title: Sewing Bag, ca. 1830
medium:
Medium: cotton, wool
Technique: sewn from roller-printed plain weave
creditline: Gift of Mary M. Kenway from the estate of Sarah B. Russell
description: Rectangular reinforced panel with a pouch at one end, a small pocket above it, and a shallow pocket at the other end; three tabs of wool and cotton stripe for pins and needles. Ground pattern of overlapping ovals in shades of deep rose overprinted with close set miniature pattern of bell-shaped flowers in bright green and yellow. Two yellow bows; tied with faded salmon pink silk ribbon.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sewing Bag, ca. 1830.
ca. 1830. Medium: cotton, wool
Technique: sewn from roller-printed plain weave. Gift of Mary M. Kenway from the estate of Sarah B. Russell. 1956-181-51.
